proof: Proof. Suppose a deterministic algorithm exists. After all, if Player $k$ outputs an independent set of size greater than $\frac{n}{\Delta^2} + \frac{n}{\Delta^2} \cdot k \cdot (96\ell^2 \ln(n) + 30)$, then we can find another set of edges to send such that each player sends the same message but the independent set is no longer valid.
